name: Escape Movies Trivia Quiz | Classic Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: "Brute Force" stars which classic actor in a "got-to-get-out-of-prison" storyline?
questions.explanation:
Burt Lancaster.

	Hume Cronyn as the tough warden.

questions.text: "Escape from Alcatraz" stars Clint Eastwood. Who plays the tough warden?
questions.explanation:
Patrick McGoohan.

	Okay, but not special.

questions.text:
"Fortune and Men's Eyes" starred Wendell Burton. Where does the title
come from?
questions.explanation:
William Shakespeare.

	"When in disgrace with fortune and men's eyes" is the opening of one of the bard's poems. Burton had a momentary success opposite Liza Minnelli in "The Sterile Cuckoo", but soon faded.

questions.text: "Each Dawn I Die" starred what tough guy?
questions.explanation:
James Cagney.

	Where better for the ultimate tough guy to be tough?

questions.text: "20,000 Years in Sing Sing" starred what actor?
questions.explanation:
Spencer Tracy.

	So-so, but always good to watch Tracy.

questions.text: The story upon which "The Shawshank Redemption" was based was written by what author?
questions.explanation:
Stephen King.

	Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman. Good (but long).

questions.text: "Papillon" involved an escape from a different kind of prison environment. What tattoo was the distinguishing feature of the title character?
questions.explanation:
Butterfly.

	Butterfly on his chest. Steve McQueen, Dustin Hoffman. Interesting because it's true (they say), but a bit long.

questions.text: Which of these is a "prison" movie?
questions.explanation:
The Last Castle.

	Again, it's Robert Redford. "Phoenix" is an airplane crash starring James Stewart. "Varrick" is a drama with Walter Matthau matching wits with the mob. "Mirage" is  Gregory Peck as an amnesia victim.

questions.text: The best for last: "The Great Escape" was superb. Who played the "scrounger"?
questions.explanation:
James Garner.

	McQueen was "cooler king". Bronson was "tunnel king". Pleasence was the "forger". Terrific movie.
